page.title: 02Laverstock Parish, housing.
page.content: { Laverstock village has changed {dramatically}since the middle of the 20c. The one time small village now has such a lot of infill housing, that the character of the area is so different. Such is the expansion, particularly over the past three decades, that the village is ever increasingly in danger of being swallowed up by its larger neighbour. Most of the housing and schools have been built since the end of the 2nd World war. To the south of the block there is one small hamlet of some 20 houses and known as Petersfinger. There is no clear reason for the name, though some claim the road pattern is likened to the Apostle's crooked digit pointing towards the spire of Salisbury Cathedral seen on the skyline. The most recent residential development is in the N.E. corner.
